title: Easter: church head laments conflict in 'historical' Russia
description: Worshipers including President Vladimir Putin crowded into Moscow’s vast Christ the Savior Cathedral for Easter services led by Russian Orthodox Church head Patriarch Kirill, a supporter of Russia’s military actions in Ukraine

title: Archeologists in Italy unearth ancient dolphin statuette
description: Excavations in the ancient city of Paestum in southern Italy have unearthed seven terracotta bull heads and a figurine of the Greek god Eros riding a dolphin

title: Israeli protests of legal overhaul show no signs of slowing
description: Israeli demonstrations against the government’s plan to overhaul the judiciary have continued, despite Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s decision to pause the contentious proposals

title: Katy Perry, Lionel Richie to perform at King Charles’s coronation concert
description: Katy Perry and Lionel Richie are among the stars set to perform at King Charles's coronation concert next month.

title: Police: 4 migrants among 6 killed in highway crash in Greece
description: Police say four migrants and a suspected trafficker have died and another six were injured when their car collided head-on with another as it sped the wrong way on a major highway in Greece near the Turkish border

title: Red Cross: Yemen’s warring sides resume releasing prisoners
description: The International Committee for the Red Cross says hundreds of detainees linked to Yemen’s conflict have been released

title: She spent 500 days alone in an underground cave — and didn’t want to leave
description: Spanish athlete Beatriz Flamini's solo challenge was studied by scientists. Her 500 days in an underground cave meant she had no idea what was happening in the world.

title: No consensus on Syrian Arab League return after Saudi summit
description: After meeting in Saudi Arabia to discuss Syria’s political fate, a group of regional leaders promised to continue talks to reach a political solution to the Syrian conflict

title: Breaking up with Russia is hard for many Western firms, despite war
description: Russia has created major obstacles for foreign companies seeking to leave, but some firms have stayed on, making money and grabbing market share, despite promising to pull out.

title: Breaking up with Russia is hard for many Western firms, despite war
description: Russia has created major obstacles for foreign companies seeking to leave, but some firms have stayed on, making money and grabbing market share, despite promising to pull out.

title: Japan approves first casino in big bet for an untapped market
description: The government approved plans for a $8.1 billion resort, which will house the country's first casino. The complex is set to open on an island in Osaka in 2029.

title: Japan auteur Kitano's latest samurai film headed to Cannes
description: Takeshi Kitano’s new film, premiering at the Cannes Film Festival next month, is a samurai story without heroes, mercilessly portraying human greed, betrayal and cruelty

title: George Mitchell’s secret to peace holds lessons — in N. Ireland and U.S.
description: In an interview, the former Senate majority leader says he believes that the keys to his success in brokering peace in Northern Ireland -- patience and listening -- are missing from today's U.S. politics.

title: Starving followers found at Kenyan pastor's property; 4 die
description: Police in coastal Kenya say they found 15 emaciated parishioners on the property of a church pastor, and four of the people died after the group was rescued and taken to a hospital

title: Christian faithful flock to 'Holy Fire' under restrictions
description: Christian worshippers thronged the Church of the Holy Sepulcher in Jerusalem to celebrate the ceremony of the “Holy Fire.”

title: Guitarist Mark Sheehan of Irish band The Script dies at 46
description: Ireland’s president has led tributes to Mark Sheehan of Irish rock band The Script after the guitarist’s death at age 46

title: Gunfire erupts in Sudan; paramilitary group claims to seize palace
description: Gunfire erupted in Khartoum as residents reported clashes between the Sudanese armed forces and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces.

title: Bus with musicians crashes in western India, killing 13
description: A passenger bus carrying dozens of members of a music troupe has fallen into a gorge in western India, killing 13 people and injuring 29

title: At least 42 people reported killed by rebels in Congo's east
description: A civil society organization in eastern Congo says a rebel group in Ituri province killed at least 42 people

title: Zimbabwe's aspiring female artists still 'frowned upon'
description: A self-portrait shows a 26-year-old artist covering her face with a yellow miner’s helmet while money spills over the edge of a traditional African reed basket she holds in her lap

title: Germany ends nuclear power era, shuts down last of its plants
description: Germany's anti-nuclear movement fought for this moment for decades. But it comes as the U.S. and other countries have renewed interest in nuclear energy.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Wagner chief suggests Moscow declare end to war; leak suspect charged
description: Yevgeniy Prigozhin, who heads the mercenary group, said in an online post that the strategic option for Moscow would be to lock down and defend its territorial gains.

title: Japanese leader Kishida evacuated after smoke bomb threat
description: An apparent smoke bomb was thrown at Prime Minister Fumio Kishida during a campaign stop. It adds to security concerns after Shinzo Abe was assassinated last year.
